items.title: Jedi vibes await with Anker’s palm-reading eufy FamiLock E34, S3, and S3 Max Matter smart locks at lows from $180
items.summary:
Through its official eufy Amazon storefront, Anker is offering Black Friday-level savings on three of its latest smart lock options with palm vein recognition and more. Things start with the FamiLock E34 Smart Lock with Matter at $179.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page $14 off coupon. This smarter security device would normally cost you $280 with the combined savings we’re seeing here, which is dropping the cost back to its all-time lowest that we only previously saw during Black Friday two weeks ago. Likewise, you also have to option to score the upgraded FamiLock S3 Smart Lock at a new all-time low of $229.49 shipped, after clipping its on-page coupon, or the most recent FamiLock S3 Max Smart Lock returning to $279.99 shipped, after clipping its on-page coupon. These devices join a lineup of other Anker eufy security deals that we rounded together, which you can browse in full here.

items.title: How to score Pokémon Legends: Z-A on Switch down at $45 Prime shipped
items.summary:
While perhaps not the most ideal option, deals on the new Pokémon Legends: Z-A have been somewhere between very hard to come by and completely non-existent. Over at Woot, however, you will find the Switch version marked down from the regular $60 to $44.99 with free shipping for Prime members (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This is indeed the Latin America Version of the game with a Spanish cover, but “all Nintendo Switch Video Games are Region Free and will function normally in any Switch console. Units ship with Spanish as the main language and English as the secondary language on the packaging.” Again, it might not be exactly what you were after, but it also might kind of an interesting collectible for U.S. gamers too, and it is one of the lowest prices we have tracked on the game to date.

items.title: Originally $1,700 Microsoft Surface Pro 2-in-1 Snapdragon X Elite Copilot+ PC with 16GB RAM/1TB SSD just hit $1,000 all-time low
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Microsoft’s Surface Pro 2-in-1 Copilot+ PC in Sapphire finish with a Snapdragon X Elite chip down to $999.99 shipped. This is originally a $1,700 model that still ranges between $1,200 and $1,700 at Amazon. Today’s deal takes $700 off its usual going rate, landing it $175 below its previous all-time low. We saw this variant bundled with a keyboard and Microsoft 365 for $1,299 earlier this year, but the standalone device hasn’t had a notable discount in some time. It’s fetching its lowest price right now, so be sure to snag it after getting more details below.

more…

items.title: Rare deal knocks over $230 off Apple’s most affordable Studio Display today
items.summary:
As part of today’s Best Buy Holiday Deals of the Day, we are tracking a relatively rare deal on Apple Studio Display. The regularly $1,599 premium-grade monitor is no small investment but it’s also not one that has seen very many discounts over the last year (and almost none as low as we have here today) – it is now just over $230 off at both Best Buy and Amazon. 

more…

items.title: Samsung Holiday sale: Galaxy Tab S11 + FREE $200 keyboard case, Fold 7, storage, more
items.summary:
Samsung has officially ended its Cyber Week event and transitioned over to a holiday sale of sorts. While not particularly marketed as a major sale event, many of the best offers from last week are carrying over here – some users are still seeing $200 off the Galaxy Tab S11 and everyone can still land a FREE Book Cover Keyboard Slim, there’s still a chance to land as much as $720 off Galaxy Z Fold 7, Galaxy Watch 8 is up to $150 off, and there’s a sizable selection of storage and SSD deals up for grabs as well.
